title: 2013 Seattle Seahawks season
summary: The 2013 season was the Seattle Seahawks' 38th in the National Football League and their fourth under head coach Pete Carroll. With the Seahawks 10th win only 11 weeks into the season, the team secured double-digit victories in consecutive seasons for the first time in franchise history. Their 13–3 regular season record is tied with the 2005 season for the best in franchise history. Seattle’s defense in 2013 is regarded by many to be one of the best in NFL history.[1]
